alert.note: Alert for Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 8:34PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FAIRFIELD AND CENTRAL HOCKING COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 834 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Hocking Hills State Park, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan, Bremen, Hocking Hills State Park, Hide-A-Way Hills, Sugar Grove, Rushville, West Rushville, Gibisonville, Ilesboro, Hideaway Hills, Lake Logan State Park, North Berne, Enterprise, Rockbridge and Oreville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
